casebody.data:
PAUL B. SCARF, PLAINTIFF, v. LUDWIG FANTON AND HENRY WOLF, CO-PARTNERS, TRADING AS FANTON & WOLF, DEFENDANTS. Decided July 9, 1926.

Before Justice Kalisch, at chambers.

For the motion, Lionel P. Kristeller. Contra, William B. Stites. Pee Ctjbiam.

The .plaintiff’s action is for rent. The defendant sets up a counter-claim for unliquidated damages. The ease is controlled by Kelly v. Faitoute Iron and Steel Co., 87 N. J. L. 567; Jenkins v. Schneidman, 4 N. J. Adv. R. 1005. The plaintiff’s motion to strike out the counter-claim is allowed.
